1{-# LANGUAGE FlexibleInstances #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Judgements: a symbolic representations of
5--   affirmed or denied statements.
6
7module Koshucode.Baala.Type.Judge.Judge
8  (
9    -- * Datatype
10    Judge (..),
11    judgeTermsMap,
12    judgeAdd,
13
14    -- * Logical quality
15    JudgeOf,
16    affirm, deny,
17    affirmJudge, denyJudge,
18    isAffirmative, isDenial, isViolative,
19    AssertType (..),
20    assertAs,
21    assertSymbol,
22
23    -- * Encode
24    EncodeJudge,
25    judgeBreak,
26    judgeMix, judgeMix2, judgeMixTab, judgeMix2Tab,
27    termNameToMix,
28    termsToMix1, termsToMix2,
29  ) where
30
31import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture                    as O
32import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                        as B
33import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax                      as S
34import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Type.Judge.JudgeClass       as D
35
36
37-- ----------------------  Datatype
38
39-- | Judgement on type 'c'.
40--
41--   Judgement (or judge for short) is divided into three parts:
42--   logical quality, name of class, and argument.
43--   Boolean values 'True' or 'False' of logical quality
44--   corresponds to affirmed or denied judge.
45--   A name of judgement class represents
46--   certain sentence class that gives intepretation of data.
47--   Sentence class has placeholders filled by
48--   'B.Named' @c@ in argument.
49
50data Judge c
51    = JudgeAffirm      S.JudgeClass [S.Term c]             -- ^ @|-- P \/x 10 \/y 20@
52    | JudgeDeny        S.JudgeClass [S.Term c]             -- ^ @|-x P \/x 10 \/y 20@
53    | JudgeMultiDeny   S.JudgeClass [S.Term c]             -- ^ @|-xx P \/x 10 \/y 20@
54    | JudgeChange      S.JudgeClass [S.Term c] [S.Term c]  -- ^ @|-c P \/x 10 +\/y 20@
55    | JudgeMultiChange S.JudgeClass [S.Term c] [S.Term c]  -- ^ @|-cc P \/x 10 +\/y 20@
56    | JudgeViolate     S.JudgeClass [S.Term c]             -- ^ @|-v P \/x 10 \/y 20@
57      deriving (Show)
58
59instance (Ord c) => Eq (Judge c) where
60    j1 == j2  = compare j1 j2 == EQ
61    j1 /= j2  = compare j1 j2 /= EQ
62
63instance (Ord c) => Ord (Judge c) where
64    compare j1 j2 =
65        let j1'  = judgeNormalize j1
66            j2'  = judgeNormalize j2
67            p1   = judgeClass j1'
68            p2   = judgeClass j2'
69            xs1  = judgeTerms j1'
70            xs2  = judgeTerms j2'
71        in compare p1 p2 O.++ compare xs1 xs2
72
73-- Apply function to each values
74instance Functor Judge where
75    fmap f j = judgeTermsMap (map g) j
76        where g (n, c) = (n, f c)
77
78-- | Map function to terms.
79judgeTermsMap :: ([S.Term a] -> [S.Term b]) -> Judge a -> Judge b
80judgeTermsMap f (JudgeAffirm      c xs)      = JudgeAffirm    c (f xs)
81judgeTermsMap f (JudgeDeny        c xs)      = JudgeDeny      c (f xs)
82judgeTermsMap f (JudgeMultiDeny   c xs)      = JudgeMultiDeny c (f xs)
83judgeTermsMap f (JudgeChange      c xs xs')  = JudgeChange    c (f xs) (f xs')
84judgeTermsMap f (JudgeMultiChange c xs xs')  = JudgeChange    c (f xs) (f xs')
85judgeTermsMap f (JudgeViolate     c xs)      = JudgeViolate   c (f xs)
86
87-- | Add a term into judgement.
88judgeAdd :: S.Term c -> O.Map (Judge c)
89judgeAdd x = judgeTermsMap (x :)
90
91-- | Normalize judgement, i.e., sort terms in alphabetical order.
92judgeNormalize :: (Ord c) => O.Map (Judge c)
93judgeNormalize = judgeTermsMap B.sort
94
95
96-- ----------------------  Logical quality
97
98-- | Construct judgement from its class and terms.
99type JudgeOf c = S.JudgeClass -> [S.Term c] -> Judge c
100
101-- | Construct affirmative judgement.
102--
103--   >>> affirm "P" [("x",10), ("y",20)] :: Judge Int
104--   JudgeAffirm "P" [("x",10), ("y",20)]
105--
106affirm :: JudgeOf c
107affirm = JudgeAffirm
108
109-- | Construct denial judgement.
110deny :: JudgeOf c
111deny = JudgeDeny
112
113-- | Affirm judgement, i.e., change logical quality to affirmative.
114affirmJudge :: O.Map (Judge c)
115affirmJudge (JudgeDeny p xs) = JudgeAffirm p xs
116affirmJudge j = j
117
118-- | Deny judgement, i.e., change logical quality to denial.
119--
120--   >>> denyJudge $ affirm "P" [("x",10), ("y",20)] :: Judge Int
121--   JudgeDeny "P" [("x",10), ("y",20)]
122--
123denyJudge :: O.Map (Judge c)
124denyJudge (JudgeAffirm p xs) = JudgeDeny p xs
125denyJudge j = j
126
127-- | Test which judgement is affirmed.
128isAffirmative :: O.Test (Judge c)
129isAffirmative (JudgeAffirm _ _) = True
130isAffirmative _                 = False
131
132-- | Test which judgement is denied.
133isDenial :: O.Test (Judge c)
134isDenial (JudgeDeny _ _)        = True
135isDenial (JudgeMultiDeny _ _)   = True
136isDenial _                      = False
137
138-- | Test which judgement is for violation.
139isViolative :: O.Test (Judge c)
140isViolative (JudgeViolate _ _)  = True
141isViolative _                   = False
142
143-- | Type of assertions.
144data AssertType
145    = AssertAffirm       -- ^ @|==@ /C/ @:@ /R/ generates affirmative judges.
146    | AssertDeny         -- ^ @|=x@ /C/ @:@ /R/ generates denial judges.
147    | AssertMultiDeny    -- ^ @|=xx@ /C/ @:@ /R/ generates multiple-denial judges.
148    | AssertChange       -- ^ @|=c@ /C/ @:@ /R/ generates changement judges.
149    | AssertMultiChange  -- ^ @|=cc@ /C/ @:@ /R/ generates multiple-changement judges.
150    | AssertViolate      -- ^ @|=v@ /C/ @:@ /R/ generates violation judges.
151      deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
152
153-- | Frege's stroke and various assertion lines.
154--
155--   >>> assertSymbol AssertAffirm
156--   "|=="
157--
158assertSymbol :: AssertType -> String
159assertSymbol AssertAffirm       = "|=="
160assertSymbol AssertDeny         = "|=X"
161assertSymbol AssertMultiDeny    = "|=XX"
162assertSymbol AssertChange       = "|=C"
163assertSymbol AssertMultiChange  = "|=CC"
164assertSymbol AssertViolate      = "|=V"
165
166-- | Create judgement corresponding to assertion type.
167assertAs :: AssertType -> JudgeOf c
168assertAs AssertAffirm        = JudgeAffirm
169assertAs AssertDeny          = JudgeDeny
170assertAs AssertMultiDeny     = JudgeMultiDeny
171-- assertAs AssertChange        = JudgeChange
172-- assertAs AssertMultiChange   = JudgeMultiChange
173assertAs AssertViolate       = JudgeViolate
174
175
176-- ----------------------  Class
177
178instance D.GetClass (Judge c) where
179    getClass = judgeClass
180
181instance D.GetTermNames (Judge c) where
182    getTermNames = map fst . judgeTerms
183
184instance D.GetTerms Judge where
185    getTerms = judgeTerms
186
187-- | Return class of judgement.
188judgeClass :: Judge c -> S.JudgeClass
189judgeClass (JudgeAffirm      c _)      = c
190judgeClass (JudgeDeny        c _)      = c
191judgeClass (JudgeMultiDeny   c _)      = c
192judgeClass (JudgeChange      c _ _)    = c
193judgeClass (JudgeMultiChange c _ _)    = c
194judgeClass (JudgeViolate     c _)      = c
195
196-- | Return term list of judgement.
197judgeTerms :: Judge c -> [S.Term c]
198judgeTerms (JudgeAffirm      _ xs)     = xs
199judgeTerms (JudgeDeny        _ xs)     = xs
200judgeTerms (JudgeMultiDeny   _ xs)     = xs
201judgeTerms (JudgeChange      _ xs _)   = xs
202judgeTerms (JudgeMultiChange _ xs _)   = xs
203judgeTerms (JudgeViolate     _ xs)     = xs
204
205
206-- ----------------------  Encode
207
208instance (B.MixEncode c) => B.MixEncode (Judge c) where
209    mixTransEncode = judgeMix2
210
211-- | Encode judgement with short sign converter.
212type EncodeJudge c = B.TransString -> Judge c -> B.MixText
213
214-- | Encode judgement with term separator.
215judgeMix :: (B.MixEncode c) => B.MixText -> EncodeJudge c
216judgeMix sep sh j =
217    case j of
218      JudgeAffirm      c xs    -> judge "|--"  c xs
219      JudgeDeny        c xs    -> judge "|-X"  c xs
220      JudgeMultiDeny   c xs    -> judge "|-XX" c xs
221      JudgeChange      c xs _  -> judge "|-C"  c xs
222      JudgeMultiChange c xs _  -> judge "|-CC" c xs
223      JudgeViolate     c xs    -> judge "|-V"  c xs
224    where
225      judge sym c xs = B.mix sym `B.mixSep` B.mix c O.++ sep O.++ termsToMix sep sh xs
226
227-- | Encode judgement with two-spaces term separator.
228judgeMix2 :: (B.MixEncode c) => EncodeJudge c
229judgeMix2 = judgeMix B.mix2
230
231-- | Encode judgement with tab term separator.
232judgeMixTab :: (B.MixEncode c) => EncodeJudge c
233judgeMixTab = judgeMix B.mixTab
234
235-- | Conditional judgement encoder.
236--   If the first argument is true, 'judgeMix2' is used, otherwise 'judgeMixTab'.
237judgeMix2Tab :: (B.MixEncode c) => Bool -> EncodeJudge c
238judgeMix2Tab True   = judgeMix2
239judgeMix2Tab False  = judgeMixTab
240
241-- | Conventional line-break setting for judges:
242--   4-spaces indent and 120-columns line.
243judgeBreak :: B.LineBreak
244judgeBreak = B.crlf4 120
245
246-- | Encode term name.
247--
248--   >>> termNameToMix "foo"
249--   MixText "/foo"
250--
251termNameToMix :: S.TermName -> B.MixText
252termNameToMix n = B.mixString $ S.termNameString n
253
254-- | Encode term list with one-space separator.
255termsToMix1 :: (B.MixEncode c) => B.TransString -> [S.Term c] -> B.MixText
256termsToMix1 = termsToMix B.mix1
257
258-- | Encode term list with two-spaces separator.
259termsToMix2 :: (B.MixEncode c) => B.TransString -> [S.Term c] -> B.MixText
260termsToMix2 = termsToMix B.mix2
261
262termsToMix :: (B.MixEncode c) => B.MixText -> B.TransString -> [S.Term c] -> B.MixText
263termsToMix sep sh ts = B.mixJoin sep $ map term ts where
264    term (n, c) = termNameToMix n `B.mixSep` B.mixTransEncode sh c
265
